definitions: To move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once.
To travel over a distance on foot.
To take an animal, especially a dog, for a walk.
To move or cause to move in a specified way by walking.
examples: She likes to walk in the park.
He walked his dog every morning.
The baby is learning to walk.
I will walk you to your car.
